page.title: 03PUBLIC TRANSPORT IN LOWDHAM.
page.content: Many different services pass through Lowdham.Buses have run to and from Lowdham for many years now.The fare from the Magna Carta Pub in Lowdham to Nottingham is 70p.It takes about half an hour. Single deckers are the most popular buses because they can go under bridges.There are a number of bridges on the routes. Tours by coach are quite often arranged through Lowdham Post Office and run all over Britain. There are two bus shelters in Lowdham,one next to the old school and the other is near the Magna Carta Pub. A train service from Nottingham stops at Lowdham.The trains go as far as Lincoln.They are never high speed trains only freight or diesel trains.
